info.name: Payment API Documentation
info.description: API documentation for the Payment Service, including legacy and transformed payment endpoints.

request.description:
This endpoint fetches payment data directly from the legacy system. The data is returned in its original format without any transformations.

**Response Structure:**
- `data`: An array of legacy payment objects.
  - Each object has the following properties:
    - `transactionId`: (string) A unique identifier for the transaction.
    - `amount`: (number) The monetary value of the payment.
    - `userId`: (string) The ID of the user who made the payment.
    - `userName`: (string) The name of the user who made the payment.
    - `date`: (string) The date and time of the transaction in ISO 8601 format.

This endpoint fetches payment data that has been transformed from the legacy system into a new, standardized format. It demonstrates how the system processes and restructures data.

**Response Structure:**
- `data`: An array of transformed payment objects.
  - Each object has the following properties:
    - `id`: (string) A unique identifier for the payment (transformed from legacy `transactionId`).
    - `amount`: (number) The monetary value of the payment.
    - `customerId`: (string) The ID of the customer associated with the payment (transformed from legacy `userId`).
    - `customerName`: (string) The name of the customer (transformed from legacy `userName`).
    - `timestamp`: (string) The date and time of the payment in ISO 8601 format (transformed from legacy `date`).

variable.description: The base URL for the API. Change this if your API is hosted elsewhere.
